result.execSummary:
The defendant Gloria G Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Woodman's. Not to possess any Quest or Food Stamps cards.
File tax returns each year with copy to agent. Any refund to restitution.
